DOC.detailed_description: This study focus youth age 6 - 15 refer community-based mental health clinic problem related disruptive behavior , depression , anxiety , traumatic stress , combination problem . Using randomized block design , therapists randomly assign deliver usual treatment procedure ( usual care , UC ) clinic evidence-based , modularized treatment ( Modular Approach Therapy Children Anxiety , Depression , Trauma , Conduct Problems , MATCH-ADTC ) . MATCH-ADTC support train supervision procedure design fit provider clinic context . Assessments carry pre-treatment , post-treatment , 3-,6-,9-,12,18- , 24-month follow-up . Assessments carry pre-treatment include ( ) individual youth problem disorder ; ( b ) individual youth function home school ; ( c ) clinic staff belief attitude toward evidence-based treatment . Assessments carry post-treatment follow-up include measure ( 1 ) youth , caregiver , therapist satisfaction treatment ; ( b ) youth , caregiver , therapist view quality therapeutic relationship ; ( c ) treatment cost . Assessments carry follow-up included measure ( ) caregiver report mental health service use follow project treatment ; ( b ) therapist report extent treatment procedure use project continue project termination . Analyses address critical question deployment evidence-based youth practice clinical setting .
